main event: The document contains a UFO report from Pleasant Hill, California on 9th October 1958. The sighting described a hazy bar of light which passed rapidly across the sky and executed a couple of turns before vanishing into the northeast.
interesting points: The object was described as a hazy bar of light, brighter at the ends than in the middle, and executing sharp turns as it traversed the sky.
An airplane ascending from Oakland to Travis was visible at the same time as the object, and the witness hastened to the Oakland Airport to report it.
The duration of the object's appearance was estimated to be no more than 15 seconds, and it seemed to be moving at a high rate of speed.
The object was reported to be too fast to be heard until the appearance of the above-mentioned plane.
The witness noted that the object's size and brightness changed rapidly as it moved, and it moved much too fast to be heard until the appearance of an airplane.
result: The conclusion of the Air Force Technical Information Sheet was that the UFO sighting was Navy balloons. Another report concluded that the sighting was an H-37 helicopter in the San Francisco area.
